MY son's medication made him very lethargic tired & he gained weight rapidly. His psychiatrist advised him to walk. He doesn't like to be seen in public we walk through the woods. I bought him a dog to keep him company & walk. If I am with him & others aren't around he will bike now & swim in the summer. He has isolated himself from friends & most activities so eating is his enjoyment. He needs support & understanding. The meds due cause weight gain & zap energy. What name of meds are U On?
Yes the meds do make you very lethargic, sleepy & weight gain. If U r able to walk someplace a little bit each day it does help.

Yes, the medicine does make you sick. All the things you are describing (weight gain, no sex drive, feeling weak) are known side effects. They are toxic to the brain and to the body.Firstly, do you think you can manage without these drugs that are making you sick? Will you be able to cope without them? And secondly, if you can't cope without them, ask for a gradual reduction in the dosage, or to switch. Seroquel is notorious for debilitating side effects. Try to stick to low doses if you can. If you decide to come off the medication, make sure you withdraw properly and slowly - this is very important or you will experience painful withdrawal symptoms.
